definition: regularly and widely used or sold, any animals kept for use or profit, to have on hand
details:
adjective
- regularly and widely used or sold
= example: regularly and widely used or sold
= synonyms: standard
- repeated too often, routine
= example: repeated too often, routine
= synonyms: commonplace
noun
- any animals kept for use or profit
= example: any animals kept for use or profit
= synonyms: livestock
- an ornamental white cravat, often worn in horse dancing
= example: an ornamental white cravat, often worn in horse dancing
= synonyms: neckcloth
- the merchandise that a shop has on hand
= example: the merchandise that a shop has on hand
= synonyms: inventory
- the handle end of some implements or tools
= example: the handle end of some implements or tools
- the handle of a handgun or the butt end of a rifle or shotgun or part of the support of a machine gun or artillery gun
= example: the handle of a handgun or the butt end of a rifle or shotgun or part of the support of a machine gun or artillery gun
= synonyms: gunstock
- lumber used in the construction of something
= example: lumber used in the construction of something
- liquid in which meat and vegetables are simmered
= example: liquid in which meat and vegetables are simmered
= synonyms: broth
- a special variety of domesticated animals within a species
= example: a special variety of domesticated animals within a species
= synonyms: strain
- the descendants of one individual
= example: the descendants of one individual
= synonyms: descent
- any of various ornamental flowering plants of the genus Malcolmia
= example: any of various ornamental flowering plants of the genus Malcolmia
- a plant or stem onto which a graft is made
= example: a plant or stem onto which a graft is made
- persistent thickened stem of a herbaceous perennial plant
= example: persistent thickened stem of a herbaceous perennial plant
= synonyms: caudex
- the capital raised by a corporation through the issue of shares entitling holders to an ownership interest
= example: the capital raised by a corporation through the issue of shares entitling holders to an ownership interest
- a supply of something available for future use
= example: a supply of something available for future use
= synonyms: store, fund
- a certificate documenting the shareholder's ownership in the corporation
= example: a certificate documenting the shareholder's ownership in the corporation
= synonyms: stock certificate
- the reputation and popularity a person has
= example: the reputation and popularity a person has
verb
- to have on hand
= example: to have on hand
= synonyms: carry
- to provide or furnish with a stock of something
= example: to provide or furnish with a stock of something
- to amass so as to keep for future use or sale or for a particular occasion or use
= example: to amass so as to keep for future use or sale or for a particular occasion or use
= synonyms: buy in, stock up
- to supply with livestock
= example: to supply with livestock
- to supply with fish
= example: to supply with fish
- to equip with a gun or tool with a handle or butt
= example: to equip with a gun or tool with a handle or butt
